definitions.body: :Is 14:4 proverb, parable (of sentences constructed in parallelism, usu. of Hebrew Wisdom, but occas. of other types);—abs. ´[[מ]] Ez Eze 17:2 + 20 t.; cstr. [[מְשַׁל]] 1Sa 24:14; sf. [[מְשָׁלוֹ]] Nu 23:7 + 8 t.; pl. [[מְשָׁלִים]] Ec 12:9 + 2 t.; cstr. [[מִשְׁלֵי]] Pr 1:1 + 3 t.;—
proverbial saying, brief terse sentence of popular sagacity 1Sa 10:12, Ez Eze 12:22, Eze 12:23, Eze 18:2, Eze 18:3; [[הַקַדְמׂנִי]] ´[[מ]] 1Sa 24:14 proverb of the ancients.

prophetic figurative discourse: [[נׇשָׂא מָשָׁל]] lift up, utter a ´[[מ]] Nu 23:7, Nu 23:18, Nu 24:3, Nu 24:15, Nu 24:20, Nu 24:21, Nu 24:23 (all of Balaam); Is 14:4, Mic 2:4 (‖[[נהי]]) Hb Hab 2:6 (‖[[חידה]]), (cf. Job 27:1, Job 29:1 for same phrase under
similitude, parable, Ez Eze 17:2, Eze 21:5, Eze 24:3.
poem, of various kinds: the ode (Nu 21:27–Nu 21:30), the 3,000 pieces traditionally ascribed to Solomon 1Ki 5:12, didactic psalms Ps 49:5, Ps 78:2.

sentences of ethical wisdom [[דִּבְרֵי חֲכָמִים]] collected in the [[מִשְׁלֵי שְׁלֽמׂה]] Pr 10:1, Pr 25:1 (Pr 10:1 – Pr 22:16 consisting of 376 couplets chiefly antithetical; Pr 25–Pr 29 chiefly couplets of an emblematic type, but also occasional tristichs, tetrastichs, pentastichs, and decastichs. To these are appended [[דְּבָרִים]] of a more mixed character as to size and content Pr 22:7–Pr 24:22; Pr 24:23-34; Pr 30:1-14; v:Pr 30:15-33; Pr 31:1-9; v:Pr 31:10-31; the Praise of Wis 1:8-9 is prefixed, and an introduction to the whole Wis 1:1-7, in which the whole contents are represented as) [[משׁלים]] Pr 1:1, cf. v:Pr 1:6. The references in Job 13:12, Job 27:1, Job 29:1, Pr 26:7, Pr 26:9, Ec 12:9 are to the same type of wisdom.
